snippet: A remarkable range of leading Republicans have been emphatic publicly or privately that they do not want to be considered as Donald J. Trump’s running mate.
abstract: Large number of leading Republicans have bluntly stated their disinterest in becoming Donald J Trump's running mate should he win GOP's presidential nomination; declarations represent rare snub of front-runner; other Republicans have signaled their openness to joining ticket because they believe Trump will win.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: A remarkable range of leading Republicans have been emphatic publicly or privately that they do not want to be considered as Donald J. Trump’s running mate.

headline.main: Run on a Ticket With Donald Trump? No, Thanks, Many Republicans Say
headline.print_headline: Run on Ticket Beside Trump? Big Names Flee
